thread.title: Lightwave Endorphin learning edition is free to download.

post.date: Posted: Fri Aug 26, 2005 3:15 am Post subject: Lightwave Endorphin learning edition is free to download.
post.author: ajm113
post.body:
I found it looking around for lightwave stuff. Have fun.
http://www.spinquad.com/forums/showthread.php?t=7208&goto=nextoldest

post.author: Rayne
post.body:
Now that's a cool program! Thanks for the news!

post.date: Posted: Fri Aug 26, 2005 1:35 pm Post subject:
post.author: modern
post.body:
I've got as far as the balcony.ens. That looks painful!

Edit: The car crash does it for me.

post.date: Posted: Sun Aug 28, 2005 12:05 am Post subject:
post.author: ajm113
post.body:
I have not tryed it yet but can you guys see if you can use it in Doom3 Editor. To make new models.
_________________
Need help on editing on the BF2 editor? Then goto www.bf2editor.org
Goto my alternitve site for my Doom3 and Quake 4 tutorials www.ajm113.yurx.com/doom3engine

post.date: Posted: Sun Aug 28, 2005 1:18 am Post subject:
post.author: Sparky
post.body:
It looks to me to be a procedural animation toolkit. As far as I can tell, it's got no modeling capability.

It also looks as though you need to buy the full version to be able to export data to another program, so I don't think the free version would be useful for Doom 3 content creation.

post.date: Posted: Sun Aug 28, 2005 1:47 am Post subject:
post.author: ajm113
post.body:
Snaps! I thoght it would do every thing I wanted it to do.
